Warning: Low on disk space
The amount of disk space available for new EPrints has dropped below the repository threshold. New disk space will be needed soon.
If you get sick of this message, lower the "diskspace_warn_threshold" in the config file. If you do this then don't forget to put it back after you add more disk space.
The usual way to add disk space is to symlink a directory on a new drive into the repository "documents" directory. ERROR: Out of Disk Space
There are no available partitions with enough disk space to create new items. This needs sorting out urgently.
NO NEW ITEMS WILL BE ADDED UNTIL YOU FIX THIS.

A year search must be specified as a single year, e.g. `2000', or a range of years, e.g. `1990-2000', `1990-' or `-2000' A numerical search must be specified as a single integer number, e.g. `23', or a range of numbers, e.g. `9-21', `17-' or `-93' A date search must be specified as a single date or a range. Search field contains no indexable words: "". The system ignores very small or common words. Enter a date or date range.

User Area Homepage -
Before you use any of the user area functions, you must fill out your user information.
View/change your user record
Select this option to see your user record, and to correct or update your user information.
Review your items in the repository
This options allows you to view your items in the repository, and to make copies of the items to make depositing updated versions easier.
Begin a New Item
This will create a new item start editing it and allow you to attach files. You must deposit the item for it to be added to the repository. Deposited items will not appear until they have been checked by a person with that responsibility. You should review your existing items if you can't remember if you have deposited an item or not.
Import an Item
Create a new item by cutting and pasting an existing bibliographic record.
Change your subscription options
Select this option to change your subscription. This allows you to instruct the repository to automatically email you with lists of documents deposited that match your criteria every day, week or month.
View the Repository status
This option allows you to view the current status of the system, including the number of items in each dataset.
Editorial Review
This option allows you to view, edit and approve items which users have submitted but have not yet been approved for the repository. You may only edit items within your editorial scope.
Staff EPrint Search
This search gives you more power than the public search. It also gives you the option to edit or delete records.
User Search
Search the list of users, view ALL their details and edit their records.
Add New User
Create a new user.
Change your Email Address
Change the email address which eprints has for you.
Use the Subject Editing Tool
This option allows you to create, delete unlink, and link items in the subject tree.
Change User Login
Log in to the repository as a different user. There is currently no "logout" feature.
These are items you are currently in the process of depositing. These will not be considered for the repository until you deposit them.
You currently have no pending items Deposited New Delete Edit Use as template New version Deposit
You have no accepted items Accepted
Review Items:
You have no items in the repository.
Below are listed your items in the repository. Click on the title of an item to view it.
New Version: This button makes a copy of the item in your workspace. Do this if you are going to submit an updated version of the item. Any attached files will also be copied.
Use as template: If you want to submit a similar item this button will create a new item in your workspacke using the current item as a template. This option will not link the new item to the old one. Any attached files will not be copied.
Request Removal: Request that the administrator removes this item.
Checkout Item: Return this item to your work area. This will mean it temporarily disappears from the repository. Document New version Use as template Checkout Request Removal Request Item Removal
Please note that we strongly discourage removal of items from the repository. If you upload a new version of an items, a link to the later version will appear on the older version. Thus, anyone finding the old version will be able to see that a newer version has been deposited.

Edit Subject: Edit Subjects Tool
This is the EPrints subject editor tool. You should be aware that it can make major changes which cannot be undone. If you remove a subject which is the only subject of an eprint then you will no longer be able to find that eprint via the browse views, only by the search.
Be careful. Think before deleting anything.
(Of course, if this is not a live repository, then it doesn't matter.)

In order to access some areas of the repository, you'll need a user registration. No charge is made for registering with us or using any of our services.

Password Leaving this field blank will not affect the password. If you change your password you will be logged out. User Type
Set a password. This will not be activated until you enter a security code which will be mailed to you. Editor Subjects The subjects within which this user may "edit" eprints. That is they may review and approve/bounce them etc. User Registration Date
Email address The email address for this user Preferred Language Your preferred language. Where possible information will be mailed in this language.
Editorial Rights Restriction The user will only be able to approve and modify items which match the following rules. If there are no restriction conditions the user will be able to edit any item. Frequency of Editorial Review Mailings How often do you want to be sent a list of all the items in editorial review matching your editorial rights. Never Once per Day Once per Week Once per Month Mail Empty Results If there are items in editorial review, within your editorial rights, should the repository still send you an empty email? Yes, mail me when editorial review is empty.
No. Only mail me when there is something I can edit and approve.
ID of the owning item Revision Language Please indicate the primary language of this format. Format Please select the storage format of this document. Description You may offer an additional brief description of the format. Visible to Please indicate the required "security level" of this document. Who is allowed to download it? License Specify an explicit license for this document (does not effect the access rights you grant at the end of this deposit process). Main file The file which is linked to.
Subject Name Revision This is the "screen" name of the subject, the one that the users will see. Subject Parents Subject(s) Depositable Can users add items to this subject? Yes, users can add items to this subject.
No. (In which case it should probably have some children. Subject ID String This is the internal key for this subject. It is used in the database and to generate the "views" filenames. It shoud contain only a-z, 0-9 and dash "/"and underscore "_". If you enter the ID of an existing subject then that subject will be linked as a child of the current subject.

Subscriptions
You may configure subscriptions to this repository. A subscription is a stored search which will be run every day, week or month. Any matching items which have been added or modified since last time will be mailed to you.
